findings.title: Unrestricted low-level call without return value handling
findings.explanation: The contract uses a.call() to invoke the fallback function of an arbitrary address without restricting the input address or checking the return value. This can result in unexpected behavior and introduce security risks.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid using low-level call. Use Solidity function calls or interfaces for known contracts and handle return values. If low-level call is necessary, verify the return value and apply appropriate access controls or input validation.

unmatched_predictions.title: Unrestricted low-level call without return value handling
